p:
Nanocomposite structure was probed by TEM. Low-resolution TEM imaging (Figure 7a) revealed that the catalyst particles had an irregular shape, with dark hexagonal and spherical particles corresponding to the α-Fe2O3–ZrO2 composite (red circle). The average size of α-Fe2O3–ZrO2 particles was determined as 42.5 nm and cylindrical particles corresponding to nanocellulose fiber (blue circle). Figure 7b–d present high-resolution TEM images of the porous cellulose@α-Fe2O3–ZrO2 nanocomposite.Figure 7
TEM image [(a) 50 nm, (b) 10 nm, (c) 10 nm and (d) 5 nm scale] of cellulose@α-Fe2O3–ZrO2.Figure 7
